description.narrative: The revised PDO is to improve the Recipient's institutional and infrastructure environment for more productive, profitable and sustainable livestock and crop production by pasture users and smallholder farmers, as well as to reduce the economic impact of the zoonotic disease burden in the human population.

condition.narrative: Funding to be allocated within the Recipient's budget for its FY 2011, to cover 50% of the cost for procuring vaccines for thebrucellosis control program in Naryn oblast in 2011, Part 2(c)(iii).

comment.narrative: Breakdown for this indicator is provided below.

title.narrative: Targeted clients who are members of an association – female (number)

comment.narrative: Under the pasture law and by PUU charters all adults in aiyl Okmotu are automatically members of the PUU. The number of adult malepeople in project areas is taken by ARIS from the National Statistical Committee data.

title.narrative: Targeted clients who are members of an association - male (number)

comment.narrative: Under the pasture law and by PUU charters all adults in aiyl Okmotu are automatically members of the PUU. The number of adult malepeople in project areas is taken by ARIS from the National Statistical Committee data.

title.narrative: Targeted clients who are members of an association (percentage)

comment.narrative: This indicator measures the membership of target clients in pasture users unions (PUU).

Under the pasture law and by PUU charters all adults in aiyl Okmotu are automatically members of the PUU. The number of adult malepeople in project areas is taken by ARIS from the National Statistical Committee data.

title.narrative: Number of Community Pasture Management Plans (CPMP) satisfactorily developed, implemented and enforced by Pasture User Associations

comment.narrative: 400 full CPMPs were prepared in by June 1 2013.

title.narrative: Number of Pasture User Unions with functioning Pasture Management Committees established and fully operational

comment.narrative: 454 PUU have been legally registered. All were operational in 2011 having issued pasture use tickets to their members.

title.narrative: Number of Farmers Koshuuns contracting advisory services using own funds

comment.narrative: 456 FKs contributed the required 50% contribution to the cost of advisory service contracts (mainly in kind e.g demo materials).

title.narrative: Percentage of pasture improvement micro-projects satisfactorily maintained

comment.narrative: A total of 993 microprojects have been completed of which 582 have been operational for 2 years or more and 411 have beenoperational for 1 year.

title.narrative: Revised legal framework reflected in Aiyl Okmotus having management authority for intermediate and distant pastures

comment.narrative: Aiyl Okmotu have management authority and have delegated authority to PUUs in all 454 cases where PUUs have been established.

title.narrative: Coverage of vaccination programs from FMD, anthrax, rabies, brucellosis, PPR, Sheep Pox, Echinococcus and Tubercullosis increases to at least 80% of target animals by end of year 2

comment.narrative: Brucellosis vaccination has been implemented nationwide in 2011, 2012, 2013. A pilot echinococcosis program is being implementedintwo raions in 2013. Regionally targeted FMD, rabies, anthrax vaccination programs are being implemented in 2013.

title.narrative: Increase in the condition score of livestock of target farmers of at least 0.5 points on a scale 1-5 by end of project
Percentage of Community Seed Banks stable or expanding

comment.narrative: The PUCSF indicate that in 2012, 223 CSFs (82%) were maintaining or growing, only 40 (15%) declining, and 9 (3%) were notfunctioning

title.narrative: Statistically significant decline in prevalence of animal and human cases of target diseases by end of project

comment.narrative: The number of human cases of Brucellosis in the first pilot region of Naryn halved from approximately 420 cases in 2008 to 210cases in 2011, in contrast to an increase in cases in regions were no sheep/ goat vaccination took place.

title.narrative: SVD ratings based OIE/PVS criteria increase from 1 to 2

comment.narrative: No information available. OIE PVS rating expected to be updated before end of 2103
SVD rating has not been updated yet by OIE.

title.narrative: Improved food supply for poor households in the program area

comment.narrative: Calorific food availability increased by 46% for the 8650 community seed fund members growing wheat with improved yields.

1. National Milk YieldThe revised NSC baseline figure for 2008 is 2003 litres.Nationally, milk production has increased by 8.6percent. This is a result of increased head of cattle (10%) but a slight decrease (1.3%) in yield per cow.2. Milk Yield on FarmsBenefiting from Extension Advice: Milk yields on 804 farms participating in farmer field schools or demonstrations increased by 38percent from 1950 litres to 2700 lites per year.

title.narrative: Number of lambs per 100 ewes surviving to age 4 months (in the program area)

comment.narrative: The main positive impact on animal productivity is through the animal disease control activities. Pasture Committees are at anearly stage of development in terms of being able to control stocking rates and increase livestock productivity frompastures.Based onresults from Ak Tala district only, which showed a decrease in Brucellosis incidence in sheep of 2.45% from9.95% (2008) to 7.50% (2012) which translates into an equivalent increase in lambing rate.
